name: OrganismsTestsByMicroscopicObservationInSpecimenFromNormallySterileSiteByGramStain
title: Organisms (Tests by Microscopic Observation in Specimen from Normally Sterile Site by Gram Stain)
description:
A normally sterile site is defined as:
 blood
 bone and bone marrow
 cerebrospinal fluid (CSF)
 internal body sites
 specimen obtained from surgery or aspirate from one of the following: brain, heart, kidney, liver, lymph node, ovary, pancreas, spleen, vascular tissue, vitreous fluid:
 joint fluid
 includes synovial fluid and needle aspirate or culture of any specific joint: ankle, elbow, hip, knee, wrist
 muscle
 pericardial fluid
 peritoneal fluid
 includes abdominal fluid, ascites
 pleural fluid
 includes chest fluid, thoracentesis fluid
purpose:
(Clinical Focus: This set of values contains codes for laboratory test names associated with gram stains from a normally sterile site),(Data Element Scope: Laboratory tests names that were ordered or observed.),(Inclusion Criteria: VSAC query: microscopic observation gram stain;  

LOINC search: 'microscopic observation (fluid or blood or bone or bone marrow or line or CSF or embryo or aspirate or tissue) gram stain -dialysis -genital -semen'),(Exclusion Criteria: Exclude LOINC codes for the following Systems: (Anal, Cervix, Genital, Genital fld, Genital mucus, Pus, Throat, Urethra, Urine, Vag, Bronchial, Ear, Nose, Sputum, Stool, Semen, Wound))
